purpleculture_examples:

豐收 [ fēng shōu ]: bumper harvest
豐富多彩 [ fēng fù duō cǎi ]: richly colorful

豐厚 [ fēng hòu ]: generous; ample

heisig_chinese_memo: Wild beans grow in the plentiful bushes of these mountains.  It's the bean bushes mountain.
Ru_trainchinese: fēng: (прил) богатый, обильный; великий; красивый, привлекательный; пухлый, округлый
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the beans (豆) on the mountain (山) with two ladders (丰) are plentiful
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Here we have a children's drawing of a plentiful row of bushes.
origin_of_ch_char_book: This Chinese character 豐 (丰, feng, abundant) also means a bulrush or reed mace. These are edible plants which are tall (about four to five feet) and they render their grain for people to eat. The stalks from the plants are also useful in making mats, hats, and baskets. The plants were even used as medicine. The ceremonial bowl filled with these useful grains evolved to mean “abundant”. Also, the character developed to mean ritual, ceremony or manners: (禮, 礼, li, ceremony; courtesy).
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscriptions from "壴", " feng " sound. " Bai " is the pictogram of a drum, and the sound symbol of " Feng " means the sound of drumming. Probably because the drum sound is magnificent and full, it extends and has the meaning of greatness and fullness. " Feng " or the addition of "攴" can be regarded as the simplified and traditional forms of the same word. (Lin Yuan) The lower part of the Xiaozhuan is wrongly shaped as a " bean ". "Shuowen" mistakenly believed that the word " feng " was derived from " dou ", and misinterpreted it as "the fullness of the bean", which is not correct. " Feng " and " Feng " are mixed in the inscriptions of the Han and Wei Dynasty, see " Feng " and " Li ". There are also glyphs from "壴" from " die " (or from " wood ") in oracle bone inscriptions and bronze inscriptions , or variants interpreted as " abundance ", but there is insufficient evidence.

" Feng " is the original form of the drum sound. Inscriptions are mostly used for bells, such as "Fengfeng [㲋泉][㲋泉]". It also means abundance, such as the historical wall plate "blessed and rich years." It is also used as a place name, such as Xiaochen Zhaigui: "Yu (only) May and Renchen, Tonggongcai (in) Feng."

" Feng " often means thick and much in the literature. Such as "Mandarin. Zhou Yushang: "The tree is courteous, and the Airen must be rich." Wei Zhao's note: "Feng, thick." "Zhan Guo Ce. "Qin Ceyi": "If few people hear about it, those with poor feathers can't fly high." An extension expresses richness, such as "Selected Works. Zhang Pingzi's "Xijing Fu": "The land is fertile and wild, and all things are Yinfu."

" Feng " also means big and tall. Such as "Lao Tzu. Chapter Fifty-Four": "The cultivation of the country, its virtue is abundance." "Liezi. "Yang Zhu": "Fengwu's beautiful clothes, rich taste and beautiful color."

" Feng " also means prosperity. Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Zhan Lu": "Zhan Zhan Rusi, in the rich grass." Three Kingdoms Wei Cao Cao "Walking out of the Summer Gate": "The trees are overgrown, the grass is luxuriant." The extension means prosperity. Such as "Lu's Spring and Autumn. Dangran: "Subordinate to Mizhong, disciples Mifeng, fill the world."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscriptions start with "壴", " feng " sound. " Bai " is the pictogram of a drum, and the sound symbol of " Feng " means the sound of drumming. Probably because the drum sound is magnificent and full, it extends and has the meaning of greatness and fullness. (Lin Yuan)
humanum_full_description:
金文從「壴」，「丰」聲。「壴」是鼓的象形，以「丰」為聲符謂擊鼓之聲蓬蓬然。可能因為鼓聲之宏大充盈故引伸而有大、滿等義。「豐」或增「攴」旁，可視為同一字之簡繁兩體。（林澐）小篆下部訛為「豆」形，《說文》誤以為「豐」字從「豆」，又誤釋為「豆之豐滿者」，不確。「豐」和「豊」在漢魏碑銘中有相混的情況，參見「豊」、「禮」。甲骨文和金文裡還有從「壴」從「亡」（或從「木」）的字形，或釋為「豐」的異體，但缺乏足夠的證據。

　　「豐」本狀鼓聲，金文多用於鐘聲，如𤼈鐘「豐豐[㲋泉][㲋泉]」。又表示豐厚的意思，如史牆盤「厚福豐年」。又用作地名，如小臣宅簋：「隹（唯）五月壬辰，同公才（在）豐。」

　　「豐」在文獻裡常表示厚、多的意思。如《國語．周語上》：「樹於有禮，艾人必豐。」韋昭注：「豐，厚也。」《戰國策．秦策一》：「寡人聞之，毛羽不豐滿者不可以高飛。」引申表示富饒，如《文選．張平子〈西京賦〉》：「徒以地沃野豐，百物殷阜。」

　　「豐」又表示大、高大的意思。如《老子．第五十四章》：「修之於國，其德乃豐。」《列子．楊朱》：「豐屋美服，厚味姣色。」

　　「豐」也表示茂盛。如《詩．小雅．湛露》：「湛湛露斯，在彼豐草。」三國魏曹操〈步出夏門行〉：「樹木叢生，百草豐茂。」引申表示昌盛。如《呂氏春秋．當染》：「從屬彌眾，弟子彌豐，充滿天下。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「壴」，「丰」聲。「壴」是鼓的象形，以「丰」為聲符謂擊鼓之聲蓬蓬然。可能因為鼓聲之宏大充盈故引伸而有大、滿等義。（林澐）

①容貌好看：豐潤。豐腴(a。身體豐滿；b。富裕；c。豐饒)。豐盈。
②風度神采：丰采(亦作“風采”)。丰度(美好的舉止姿態，風度)。
③盛，多，大：豐盛。豐碑(高大的石碑，喻不朽的傑作或偉大的功績)。豐富。豐沛。豐饒。
④姓氏。

金文從「 壴 」，「 丰 」聲。「 壴 」是鼓的象形，以「 丰 」為聲符謂擊鼓之聲蓬蓬然。可能因為鼓聲之宏大充盈故引伸而有大、滿等義。「 豐 」或增「 攴 」旁，可視為同一字之簡繁兩體。（林澐）小篆下部訛為「 豆 」形，《說文》誤以為「 豐 」字從「 豆 」，又誤釋為「豆之豐滿者」，不確。「 豐 」和「 豊 」在漢魏碑銘中有相混的情況，參見「 豊 」、「 禮 」。甲骨文和金文裡還有從「 壴 」從「 亡 」（或從「 木 」）的字形，或釋為「 豐 」的異體，但缺乏足夠的證據。 「 豐 」本狀鼓聲，金文多用於鐘聲，如𤼈鐘「豐豐[㲋泉][㲋泉]」。又表示豐厚的意思，如史牆盤「厚福豐年」。又用作地名，如小臣宅簋：「隹（唯）五月壬辰，同公才（在）豐。」 「 豐 」在文獻裡常表示厚、多的意思。如《國語．周語上》：「樹於有禮，艾人必豐。」韋昭注：「豐，厚也。」《戰國策．秦策一》：「寡人聞之，毛羽不豐滿者不可以高飛。」引申表示富饒，如《文選．張平子〈西京賦〉》：「徒以地沃野豐，百物殷阜。」 「 豐 」又表示大、高大的意思。如《老子．第五十四章》：「修之於國，其德乃豐。」《列子．楊朱》：「豐屋美服，厚味姣色。」 「 豐 」也表示茂盛。如《詩．小雅．湛露》：「湛湛露斯，在彼豐草。」三國魏曹操〈步出夏門行〉：「樹木叢生，百草豐茂。」引申表示昌盛。如《呂氏春秋．當染》：「從屬彌眾，弟子彌豐，充滿天下。」
Bronze inscriptions from " 壴", " feng" sound. " Bai" is the pictogram of a drum, and the sound symbol of " Feng" means the sound of drumming. Probably because the drum sound is magnificent and full, it extends and has the meaning of greatness and fullness. " Feng" or the addition of " 攴" can be regarded as the simplified and traditional forms of the same word. (Lin Yuan) The lower part of the Xiaozhuan is wrongly shaped as a " bean". "Shuowen" mistakenly believed that the word " feng" was derived from " dou", and misinterpreted it as "the fullness of the bean", which is not correct. " Feng" and " Feng" are mixed in the inscriptions of the Han and Wei Dynasty, see " Feng" and " Li". There are also glyphs from " 壴" from " die" (or from " wood") in oracle bone inscriptions and bronze inscriptions, or variants interpreted as " abundance", but there is insufficient evidence. " Feng" is the original form of the drum sound. Inscriptions are mostly used for bells, such as "Fengfeng [㲋泉][㲋泉]". It also means abundance, such as the historical wall plate "blessed and rich years." It is also used as a place name, such as Xiaochen Zhaigui: "Yu (only) May and Renchen, Tonggongcai (in) Feng." " Feng" often means thick and much in the literature. Such as "Mandarin. Zhou Yushang: "The tree is courteous, and the Airen must be rich." Wei Zhao's note: "Feng, thick." "Zhan Guo Ce. "Qin Ceyi": "If few people hear about it, those with poor feathers can't fly high." An extension expresses richness, such as "Selected Works. Zhang Pingzi's "Xijing Fu": "The land is fertile and wild, and all things are Yinfu." " Feng" also means big and tall. Such as "Lao Tzu. Chapter Fifty-Four": "The cultivation of the country, its virtue is abundance." "Liezi. "Yang Zhu": "Fengwu's beautiful clothes, rich taste and beautiful color." " Feng" also means prosperity. Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Zhan Lu": "Zhan Zhan Rusi, in the rich grass." Three Kingdoms Wei Cao Cao "Walking out of the Summer Gate": "The trees are overgrown, the grass is luxuriant." The extension means prosperity. Such as "Lu's Spring and Autumn. Dangran: "Subordinate to Mizhong, disciples Mifeng, fill the world."

豐字的基本解释

豐
fēng
见“丰”③④。

豐字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fēng］
［《廣韻》敷隆切，平東，敷。］
亦作“豊2”。
(1)古代承放爵、觶的礼器。
(2)大；高大。
(3)增大；扩大。
(4)茂盛。参见“豐草”。
(5)浓密。
(6)厚；使丰厚。
(7)盛多。多指事物的数量。
(8)谓使多。
(9)丰足；丰裕。
(10)谓使丰足、丰裕。
(11)富饶。
(12)丰收。
(13)丰满。多指体态。
(14)谓使丰满。
(15)莞草。参见“豐席”。
(16)地名。周国都名。在今陕西省西安市西南。
(17)地名。秦沛县之丰邑，汉置县。今江苏省徐州市丰县。
(18)传说中的古侯国名。参见“豐侯”。
(19)《易》六十四卦之一。卦象为；离下震上。参阅《易·丰》。
(20)姓。春秋时鲁有丰愆。见《左传·昭公二十一年》。

豐字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【豆字部】　豐； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1193第12
〔古文〕??【唐韻】敷戎切【集韻】【韻會】敷馮切，?音酆。【說文】豆之豐滿者也。一曰器名，鄕飮酒有豐侯，亦謂之廢禁。【陸佃云】似豆而?。【海錄碎事】《射禮》：置豐於西階。古豐國之君以酒亡國，故以爲罰爵，圖其人形於下寓戒也。【儀禮·鄕射禮】司射適堂西，命弟子設豐。【註】將飮不勝者，設豐所以承其爵也。【疏】按《燕禮》君尊有豐，此言承爵豐，則兩用之。又【玉篇】大也。【廣韻】多也。【易·豐卦疏】豐者，多大之名，盈足之義。財多德大，故謂之豐。【書·高宗肜日】典祀無豐于昵。【疏】謂犧牲禮物多也。【楚語】彼若謀楚，其必有豐敗也哉。【註】大也。【揚子·方言】凡物之大貌曰豐。又趙魏之郊，燕之北鄙，凡大人謂之豐人。燕記曰：豐人杼首。杼首，長首也。　又【廣韻】茂也，盛也。【詩·小雅】在彼豐草。【傳】豐，茂也。【楚語】夫事君者，不以豐約舉。【註】豐，盛。約，衰也。　又猶厚也。【周禮·地官·大司徒】原隰，其民豐肉而庳。　又歲熟曰豐。【詩·周頌】豐年多黍多稌。【公羊傳·桓

豐字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文金文楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
豐字的起名意思

暂无。

Abundance
Basic explanation of words
Abundance
fēng
See "Feng" ③④.
Abundance
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fēng］
["Guangyun" Fulongqie, Pingdong, Fu. ]
Also known as "豊2".
(1) The ritual vessels used in ancient times to inherit the grandeur and grandeur.
(2) Big; tall.
(3) Increase; expand.
(4) Lush. See "Feng Cao".
(5) Thick.
(6) Thick; make rich.
(7) Shengdo. Multi-refers to the number of things.
(8) Said to make more.
(9) Plenty; abundance.
(10) It is said to make abundance and abundance.
(11) Richness.
(12) Good harvest.
(13) Plump. Multi-fingered posture.
(14) That makes fullness.
(15) Wancao. See "Feng Xi".
(16) Place name. The name of the State of Zhou. In today's southwest of Xi'an, Shaanxi Province.
(17) Place name. Fengyi of Qinpei County, Han Dynasty was home to the county. Today, Feng County, Xuzhou City, Jiangsu Province.
(18) The legendary name of the ancient country. See "Fenghou".
(19) One of the sixty-four hexagrams in the Book of Changes. The hexagram image is ; away from the lower and shaking up. See "Yi Feng".
(20) Last name. During the Spring and Autumn Period, Lu Youfeng was stunned. See "Twenty-one Years of Zuo Zhuan · Zhao Gong".
